work.name: The Lung and Sleep Center of North Texas
highlights: Evaluated and managed common chief complaints such as shortness of breath, chronic cough, pulmonary nodules, and hypersomnia, as well as COPD, asthma, interstitial lung disease, and obstructive sleep apnea
Interpreted diagnostic tests including pulmonary function tests, chest CT and radiographs, pleural fluid analysis

work.name: Texas Health Care
highlights: Performed comprehensive Well Woman exams including breast and pelvic exams, STI testing, contraception and preventive health counseling, and routine prenatal care
Assessed common complaints, including breast mass, abnormal uterine bleeding, dyspareunia, pelvic pain, and perimenopause for a diverse patient population, ranging from young adult to geriatric
Performed and assisted with subcutaneous hormone pellet implantation, colposcopy, IUD insertion, LEEP

work.name: JPS Health
highlights: Conducted detailed psychiatric assessments, monitored symptom progression, and refined treatment plans for patients with schezophrenia, mood disorders, and personality disorders in a locked long-term care unit
Evaluated and dispositioned patients in the psychiatric emergency department with chief complaints such as suicidal ideation/attempt, acute psychosis, and acute mania
Developed fund of knowledge through self-guided study of neuroleptic malignant syndrome, catatonia, and schizophrenia management

work.name: Texas Health Harris Methodist Hospital
highlights: Gained exposure to the acute care of critically ill patients in a Level 1 Trauma Center

Assessed patients with a diverse array of acuity levels (ESI 2 to 4) and chief complaints, including altered mental status, falls and motor vehicle collisions, chest pain, abdominal pain, headache, and back pain
Performed and assisted with laceration repair (suturing, stapling), splinting, fascia iliaca nerve block

work.name: Creekside Family Practice
highlights: Obtained histories, performed physical exams, and reviewed labs and diagnostic studies for up to 13 patients/day in a fast-paced outpatient clinic serving a diverse patient population

Educated patients on disease management and prevention, especially emphasizing preventive health screenings and lifestyle modifications for chronic cardiovascular diseases, obesity, and diabetes mellitus

work.name: Center for Neurology and Neurophysiology
highlights: Evaluated common complaints including headache, neuropathy, vestibular disorders, memory loss, and concussion, utilizing findings from comprehensive history-taking and physical exams
Observed chemodenervation injections and nerve blocks for refractory headaches and neuromuscular disorders

work.name: Bouvé College of Health Sciences, Northeastern University
highlights: Led pre-exam recitations for first-year Doctor of Physical Therapy students and guided labs for identifying anatomical structures of the skull, brain, and spinal cord on models, human cadavers, and images of cross-sectional slices

projects.name: HEAL 24th Annual Summit
projects.entity: Health Equity Alliance of Tarrant County, Hurst, TX
highlights: Presented Master’s Project at local maternal and child health conference: Yan J, Zwernemann R, Holmes V, Brosnan A. _Ruptured ovarian pregnancy: an important differential for abdominal pain_. Poster presented at: Health Equity Alliance of Tarrant County Summit 2025; September 18 2025; Hurst, Texas
